Kindly add the following content to the about us section of the NAVCHETNA app:
Established in 1985, Society for Promotion of Youth and Masses (SPYM) is a national organization working on drug demand reduction among children and adults and provides rehabilitation support for recovery.
SPYM with the support from the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment (MSJE), Government of India developed a series of training modules titled “NAVCHETNA: A New Consciousness on Life Skills and Drug Education for School Children”. The evidence-based training modules have been divided into Upper Primary (Grade VI to Grade VIII: containing three modules) and Secondary Schools (Grade IX to Grade XI: containing six modules) in order to address the gap between planning and execution of existing training packages for adults in India that fail to match the specific needs of teachers to educate school children to strengthen life skills with the inclusion of drug use issues.
The “NAVCHETNA” module was launched on July 30, 2022 in Chandigarh by Shri. Amit Shah, Hon’ble Minister of Home Affairs. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Executive Director, SPYM received felicitation for contributing towards Child Welfare through this module by Shri. Amit Shah, Hon’ble Minister of Home Affairs.
